data.text:
Personal information Born 12 December 1995 (1995-12-12) (age 28)

Lahore, Pakistan Batting style Left hand Role Top-order batsman Relations Inzamam-ul-Haq (Uncle) International information National side Pakistan ODI debut (cap 215) 18 October 2017 v Sri Lanka Last ODI 23 October 2017 v Sri Lanka ODI shirt no. 26 Domestic team information Years Team 2012–2015 Lahore Lions Career statistics Competition ODI FC Matches 3 31 Runs scored 147 1744 Batting average 73.50 37.10 100s/50s 1/0 4/9 Top score 100 200* Balls bowled – 102 Wickets – 1 Bowling average – 58.00 5 wickets in innings – 0 10 wickets in match n/a 0 Best bowling – 1/4 Catches/stumpings 0/- 0/- Source: ESPNcricinfo, 23 October 2017

Imam-ul-Haq (born 12 December 1995) is a Pakistani international cricketer. On his One Day International (ODI) debut against Sri Lanka, he became the second batsman for Pakistan, and thirteenth overall, to score a century on debut. He is the nephew of Inzamam-ul-Haq, a former Pakistan senior cricket team captain.

Domestic career[]

In the final of the 2016–17 Quaid-e-Azam Trophy, he scored 200 not out batting for Habib Bank Limited. In the final of 2017–18 National T20 Cup, he scored 59 not batting for Lahore Blues, and was named man of the match.

International career[]

In October 2017, he was named in Pakistan's One Day International (ODI) squad for their series against Sri Lanka. He made his ODI debut for Pakistan against Sri Lanka on 18 October 2017, scored a maiden ODI century and was named man of the match. He is the second Pakistan batsman after Saleem Elahi to score his maiden ODI hundred on debut.

In April 2018, he was named in Pakistan's Test squad for their tours to Ireland and England in May 2018.

[]
